New Records: The Chicago White Sox set a franchise record with their 107th loss.
Key Match Events: Sean Manaea pitched two-hit ball over seven innings.
Francisco Lindor belted his 29th home run.
Starling Marte drove an RBI double off the center-field wall against Justin Anderson in the ninth.
Manaea struck out five, walked two, and hit a batter with a pitch.
Luis Robert Jr. got hit by a pitch leading off but was thrown out trying to steal second.
Andrew Vaughn walked with two outs and Gavin Sheets singled in front of sliding left fielder Jesse Winker, putting runners on the corners.
Manaea then retired Vargas on a fly to left to escape that jam.
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Carlos Mendoza emphasized the need to stay locked in and match the opponent's energy.
Interim manager Grady Sizemore mentioned the situation with Garrett Crochet and his pitch count.
Post-Match Reflections: Carlos Mendoza expressed pride in the team's resilience after the win.
Grady Sizemore acknowledged the frustration with Garrett Crochet’s limited workload.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Chicago completed the first 0-10 homestand in franchise history.
The White Sox have been on the wrong end of 22 series sweeps — tops in the majors by a wide margin.
Miami is second with 10 series sweeps.
Others: Miami is second with 10 series sweeps — tops in the majors by a wide margin.
